name: SurfShop
description: Social commerce marketplace tailored to buying and selling surf-related gear. SurfShop is an in-development project venture built with React on the client side and Google’s Firebase platform on the backend. The application will allow users to share products they wish to sell and find products in their area that they wish to buy from other users. First iterations of the project will focus on creating a classifieds-like experience where the site handles only introducing buyers and sellers; with goals of incorporating e-commerce functionality directly into the site in future iterations.

name: Should I Shred
description: Surf conditions tracker built with React, NodeJs, Express, and MongoDB. This app was designed to be used for quickly gathering relevant surf information for 100's of locations around the US. Project priorities included ease of use to help foster a quick decision as to whether the user should grab their board or not, as well as slick animations for a pleasant experience.\n Note that reliable tide data was not easily accessible for each location and was therefore deamed beyond the scope of this project. As a result, the tide data displayed for each location is randomly generated on page load.

name: ListRank
description: Customizable rankings app built with React. Designed for simplicity, this app is meant to be passed around among a group of friends.

name: Pokedex
description: Index of all pokemon and their basic information always up to date through the use of pokeapi. Built with React and React-Router for a streamlined experience.

name: Tic Tac Toe
description: Multiplayer game of Tic Tac Toe that uses NodeJS and Socket.io to connect players across multiple browsers.

name: Chase's Weather App
description: Powered by Dark Sky’s weather API, CWA is built with Node.js and EJS and allows users to create an account and save locations around the country. The login / sign up system is built with Passport.js and MongoDB. \n CWA was the first full-fledged website that I created, and while this clearly shows in the design of the application, I am quite proud of this project as both a culmination of all that I learned on my own to create my first website, and also as a representation of how far I have since come as a developer.
